channel.title: Crafting error
channel.description:
So i added crafting and like it will let me make one amulet but then it will show this
[IMG]http://i62.tinypic.com/p3gpv.png[/img]
then it will stop making amulets
I have the method where u need a gold bar a cut gem and a mould to make amulets and jewlery
and also whenever I farm I get the same problem I ahve the method where u need a rake seeds and a seed dipper its not letting me far but it was working 3 days ago I need help mopar community (:

item.dc:creator: @jackfrost890 jackfrost890

@jackfrost890 wrote:

i tried reloggin doesnt work and ima check if anything is set to true

item.title: Crafting error
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

jackfrost890:

lol it only lets me make jewelery once then it stops unless I restart my server?

Is there a different error or anything else? Have you tried re-logging. If no errors, and you tried relogging, there might be a flag that’s set to true and never gets reset (and it might not be an instanced variable, so everyone has the same status).

Read full topic

item.title: Crafting error
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“HcoJustin, post:14, topic:543586”][quote author=sk8rdude461 link=topic=662465.msg4428012#msg4428012 date=1401758847]
I remember this issue.
Honestly, I solved it by removing this line:
ObjectDef.getObjectDef(objectID).name.equalsIgnoreCase(“furnace”)

And replaced it with:

objectID == 2781

Note: This will only work with 1 furnace that way.
[/quote]

Or you know… Do it logically?

ObjecfDef def = ObjectDef.getObjectDef(objectId); if(def != null && def.name.equalsIgnoreCase("furnace")) {[/quote]
Yeah, yeah. I know.
This was just a temporary solution because I hadn’t tested why the object name was nulling.
I also don’t have this crafting implemented, and do not plan on implementing it to test this.

Read full topic

item.description:
@jackfrost890 wrote:

but wouldnt it be line 29 in my useitem.java and if so this how it looks like

if (ObjectDef.getObjectDef(objectID).name.equalsIgnoreCase(“furnace”) && itemId == 2357) {
JewerlryMaking.jewelryInterface©;
}

and thank yall for what yall are doing even tho i dont know the problem yall arent spoon feeding me but helping me to expand my knowledge in java without bashing me . I really wanna know how to fix this tho

item.title: Crafting error
item.dc:creator: @tyb97 tyb97
item.description:
@tyb97 wrote:

jackfrost890, you will not get errors in your eclipse project because these are not syntax errors, NullPointerException is thrown while the program is runnning.

      int b = c.getInStream().readUnsignedWord();

This is wrong, its an issue with your packet reading. The correct packet structure can be found here: https://rswiki.moparisthebest.com/index.php?title=317:Item_on_object

Review your code with that, and you’ll figure it out.

Read full topic

item.title: Crafting error
item.dc:creator: @IfearI IfearI
item.description:
@IfearI wrote:

jackfrost890:

Ima test it and then get back at u but if it is null what do I do from there remove it?

You want to remove the “test” we added after this. If it’s null you gotta figure out why it happens to be null retrace the step (Eclipse has a nice debugger as well if you want to run that one…and check variables)

Read full topic

item.description:
@IfearI wrote:

jackfrost890:

so how do I add this check my kind sir and I tried eclipse it showed up 0 errors

I meant run in Eclipse, so like with errors you click on the line where it happens and it brings you there straight away etc.

if(c == null || c.getInStream() == null) { //<------- check if either one of them is null System.out.println("Shit, we were right c or instream is null."); // <- print a message if it is else we've got a wrong line. }

item.title: Crafting error
item.dc:creator: @IfearI IfearI
item.description:
@IfearI wrote:

Why don’t you use an IDE (Eclipse, NetBeans,…)? Makes your life much easier…

anyway, int b = c.getInStream().readUnsignedWord();

would be a NullPointException if c is null or getInSteam() returns null… You could add a check that prints something if that is the case, if so then that is what caused it. If not, we’re looking at a wrong line I believe.

Read full topic
